intro: Yunckeria ovandensis, commonly known as the ovandensis yunckeria, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
